full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 759 Filed 08/10/22 Page 40 of 267 2068 LCAVMAX2 A. Farmer - direct A. Yeah. I think that I was obviously very conflicted because I knew what had happened in the movie theater was not normal or right. And but it had made me feel very uncomfortable. But I was trying to come up with excuses or justifications in my mind to make it seem okay, because of what I saw as, you know, him being such a generous, nice person. And so, you know, I'm trying to -- I'm trying to make sense of it and I'm having a hard time. Q. I'll ask you to continue reading from where it says "Right now." A. Right now my big concern is what I am going to do this summer. There are so many cools things to do and amazing places to go. Right now I'm really thinking about doing something in Africa. It would be incredible. So different, so beautiful, all the different people. I would love it. I think I will really be happy doing almost anything. MS. POMERANTZ: Ms. Drescher, we can take that down. Your Honor, may I have just one moment please? THE COURT: You may. (Counsel conferred) BY MS. POMERANTZ: Q. Annie, after meeting Epstein in New York, did you and Epstein stay in touch? A. Yes. Q. How did you and Epstein communicate? SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013631

text_blocks.content: A. Yeah. I think that I was obviously very conflicted because I knew what had happened in the movie theater was not normal or right. And but it had made me feel very uncomfortable. But I was trying to come up with excuses or justifications in my mind to make it seem okay, because of what I saw as, you know, him being such a generous, nice person. And so, you know, I'm trying to -- I'm trying to make sense of it and I'm having a hard time.
Q. I'll ask you to continue reading from where it says "Right now."

A. Right now my big concern is what I am going to do this summer. There are so many cools things to do and amazing places to go. Right now I'm really thinking about doing something in Africa. It would be incredible. So different, so beautiful, all the different people. I would love it. I think I will really be happy doing almost anything.
MS. POMERANTZ: Ms. Drescher, we can take that down. Your Honor, may I have just one moment please? THE COURT: You may. (Counsel conferred) BY MS. POMERANTZ:
Q. Annie, after meeting Epstein in New York, did you and Epstein stay in touch? A. Yes. Q. How did you and Epstein communicate?
